rev.diff:
Line 168: Line 168:
[[Archbishop of Canterbury]] Dr. [[Rowan Williams]] condemned the bombing, declaring that "The New Year's Eve attack on Christians in Alexandria is yet another dreadful reminder of the pressure Christian minorities are under in the [[Middle East]], echoing the atrocities we have seen in recent weeks", in reference to the [[2010 Baghdad church attack|attack on the church of Our Lady of Salvation]] in [[Iraq]], carried out by the [[Islamic State of Iraq]].<ref name="Telegraph">{{cite news|title=Car bomb in Egypt kills at least 17 outside Christian church|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/africaandindianocean/egypt/8235037/Car-bomb-in-Egypt-kills-at-least-17-outside-Christian-church.html|accessdate=2 January 2011|newspaper=The Telegraph|date=2 January 2011}}</ref>
[[Archbishop of Canterbury]] Dr. [[Rowan Williams]] condemned the bombing, declaring that "The New Year's Eve attack on Christians in Alexandria is yet another dreadful reminder of the pressure Christian minorities are under in the [[Middle East]], echoing the atrocities we have seen in recent weeks", in reference to the [[2010 Baghdad church attack|attack on the church of Our Lady of Salvation]] in [[Iraq]], carried out by the [[Islamic State of Iraq]].<ref name="Telegraph">{{cite news|title=Car bomb in Egypt kills at least 17 outside Christian church|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/africaandindianocean/egypt/8235037/Car-bomb-in-Egypt-kills-at-least-17-outside-Christian-church.html|accessdate=2 January 2011|newspaper=The Telegraph|date=2 January 2011}}</ref>
â
U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] condemned the bombing, stating that: "The perpetrators of this attack were clearly targeting Christian worshipers, and have no respect for human life and dignity. They must be brought to justice for this barbaric and heinous act."<ref name="thehill.com">[http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/135579-obama-strongly-condemns-attacks-one-clearly-targeting-christian-worshippers Obama condemns attacks, one 'clearly targeting Christians' By Bridget Johnson â 01/01/11 {{Nowrap|01:45 pm}} ET]</ref><ref>[http://democratifi.com/news/Obama-condemns-deadly-attacks-in-Egypt-Nigeria-1483197.html Obama condemns deadly attacks in Egypt, Nigeria. The Daily Caller]</ref> Obama also offered assistance to the Egyptian government in responding to the "terrible event."<ref name="thehill.com"/>
+
* {{flagicon|United States}}Â U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] condemned the bombing, stating that: "The perpetrators of this attack were clearly targeting Christian worshipers, and have no respect for human life and dignity. They must be brought to justice for this barbaric and heinous act."<ref name="thehill.com">[http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/135579-obama-strongly-condemns-attacks-one-clearly-targeting-christian-worshippers Obama condemns attacks, one 'clearly targeting Christians' By Bridget Johnson â 01/01/11 {{Nowrap|01:45 pm}} ET]</ref><ref>[http://democratifi.com/news/Obama-condemns-deadly-attacks-in-Egypt-Nigeria-1483197.html Obama condemns deadly attacks in Egypt, Nigeria. The Daily Caller]</ref> Obama also offered assistance to the Egyptian government in responding to the "terrible event."<ref name="thehill.com"/>
â
French President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] denounced the "blind and cowardly crime" against Christians in Egypt and expressed his "shock and great sadness". Sarkozy also called upon Egyptian president [[Hosni Mubarak]] to "find and punish the perpetrators and sponsors of this indiscriminate and cowardly crime."<ref name="Ø±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ©"/><ref name="Sarkozy">{{cite news|title=(Sarkozy) Attack in Egypt: "an indiscriminate and cowardly crime"|url=http://www.allvoices.com/contributed-news/7767865-sarkozy-attack-in-egypt-an-indiscriminate-and-cowardly-crime|accessdate=1 January 2011|newspaper=Elaph|date=1 January 2011}}</ref>
+
* {{flagicon|France}}Â French President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] denounced the "blind and cowardly crime" against Christians in Egypt and expressed his "shock and great sadness". Sarkozy also called upon Egyptian president [[Hosni Mubarak]] to "find and punish the perpetrators and sponsors of this indiscriminate and cowardly crime."<ref name="Ø±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ©"/><ref name="Sarkozy">{{cite news|title=(Sarkozy) Attack in Egypt: "an indiscriminate and cowardly crime"|url=http://www.allvoices.com/contributed-news/7767865-sarkozy-attack-in-egypt-an-indiscriminate-and-cowardly-crime|accessdate=1 January 2011|newspaper=Elaph|date=1 January 2011}}</ref>
On the day of the massacre, French Prime Minister [[FranÃ§ois Fillon]], who was vacationing in the [[Upper Egypt]]ian city of [[Aswan]], visited the [[Coptic Orthodox]] cathedral in [[Aswan]] to pray for the souls of the victims, to express solidarity with the Coptic community and to express France's commitment to defending religious freedom in Egypt and the world.<ref name="Asia One">{{cite news|title=Egypt minister pelted, fears of sectarian unrest|url=http://news.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne+News/World/Story/A1Story20110103-256060.html|accessdate=3 January 2011|newspaper=Asia One|date=3 January 2011}}</ref><ref name="The Australian">{{cite news|title=Egypt Christians vent anger over bombing|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/egypt-christians-vent-anger-over-bombing/story-e6frg6so-1225980959860|accessdate=3 January 2011|newspaper=Asia One|date=3 January 2011}}</ref>
On the day of the massacre, French Prime Minister [[FranÃ§ois Fillon]], who was vacationing in the [[Upper Egypt]]ian city of [[Aswan]], visited the [[Coptic Orthodox]] cathedral in [[Aswan]] to pray for the souls of the victims, to express solidarity with the Coptic community and to express France's commitment to defending religious freedom in Egypt and the world.<ref name="Asia One">{{cite news|title=Egypt minister pelted, fears of sectarian unrest|url=http://news.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne+News/World/Story/A1Story20110103-256060.html|accessdate=3 January 2011|newspaper=Asia One|date=3 January 2011}}</ref><ref name="The Australian">{{cite news|title=Egypt Christians vent anger over bombing|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/egypt-christians-vent-anger-over-bombing/story-e6frg6so-1225980959860|accessdate=3 January 2011|newspaper=Asia One|date=3 January 2011}}</ref>
â
In [[Rome]], the Italian foreign ministry issued a statement "firmly condemning" the attack and confirming that Italy would "continue to make its voice heard to ensure the full protection of religious freedom in all the circumstances".<ref name="Ø±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ©">{{cite news|title=Ø£ÙØ¨Ø§ÙØ§ ÙØ¯ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ§Ø¹ØªØ¯Ø§Ø¡ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ§Ø±ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙÙ ÙÙ ÙØµØ± ÙÙÙØ¬ÙØ±ÙØ§ ÙØ±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ© |url=http://www.elaph.com/Web/news/2011/1/622244.html|accessdate=2 January 2011|newspaper=Elaph|date=2 January 2011}}</ref>
+
* {{flagicon|Italy}}Â In [[Rome]], the Italian foreign ministry issued a statement "firmly condemning" the attack and confirming that Italy would "continue to make its voice heard to ensure the full protection of religious freedom in all the circumstances".<ref name="Ø±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ©">{{cite news|title=Ø£ÙØ¨Ø§ÙØ§ ÙØ¯ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ§Ø¹ØªØ¯Ø§Ø¡ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ§Ø±ÙØ§Ø¨ÙÙÙ ÙÙ ÙØµØ± ÙÙÙØ¬ÙØ±ÙØ§ ÙØ±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ© |url=http://www.elaph.com/Web/news/2011/1/622244.html|accessdate=2 January 2011|newspaper=Elaph|date=2 January 2011}}</ref>
â
In [[Lebanon]], separate condemnations came from the [[Eastern Orthodox]] [[Greek Orthodox Church of Antioch|Patriarch of Antioch and the Orient]] [[Ignatius IV of Antioch|Ignatius IV Hazim]], [[Sunni]] Mufti of the Republic Mohammad Qabbani and Deputy Head of the Shiite Supreme Council Abdul Amir Qabalan.<ref name="iLoubnan">{{cite news|title=Lebanese Leaders Condemn Alexandria Church Massacre|url=http://www.iloubnan.info/politics/actualite/id/53775|accessdate=1 January 2011|newspaper=iLoubnan|date=1 January 2011}}</ref>
+
* {{flagicon|Lebanon}}Â In [[Lebanon]], separate condemnations came from the [[Eastern Orthodox]] [[Greek Orthodox Church of Antioch|Patriarch of Antioch and the Orient]] [[Ignatius IV of Antioch|Ignatius IV Hazim]], [[Sunni]] Mufti of the Republic Mohammad Qabbani and Deputy Head of the Shiite Supreme Council Abdul Amir Qabalan.<ref name="iLoubnan">{{cite news|title=Lebanese Leaders Condemn Alexandria Church Massacre|url=http://www.iloubnan.info/politics/actualite/id/53775|accessdate=1 January 2011|newspaper=iLoubnan|date=1 January 2011}}</ref>
â
In [[Israel]], Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] expressed his "great shock" and reaffirmed his conviction of "the need for a common front by all countries that believe in freedom in the face of terrorism".<ref name="Ø±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ©"/>
+
* {{flagicon|Israel}}Â In [[Israel]], Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] expressed his "great shock" and reaffirmed his conviction of "the need for a common front by all countries that believe in freedom in the face of terrorism".<ref name="Ø±Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÙØ¹Ù Ø¹Ø±Ø¨ÙØ© ÙØ¹Ø§ÙÙÙØ©"/>
The [[Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem]] [[Fouad Twal]] called on [[Christians]] to show courage in the face of the attack, declaring that "This latest massacre must lead us to reflect on our vocation as Christians in this [[Middle East|region]], which cannot be allowed to turn its back on the [[Christian cross|Cross]]".<ref name="VancouverSun"/>
The [[Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem]] [[Fouad Twal]] called on [[Christians]] to show courage in the face of the attack, declaring that "This latest massacre must lead us to reflect on our vocation as Christians in this [[Middle East|region]], which cannot be allowed to turn its back on the [[Christian cross|Cross]]".<ref name="VancouverSun"/>
